text:
Hi guys, any update on this?
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/CMS-Development/Can-you-setup-local-development-on-HubSpot-CMS/td-p/199430>

<https://github.com/Absanater/HubSpot-frontend-local/commits?author=Absanater>

<@U22PKFRU5> <@UDC6ATL20>

there’s the local Hubl server, and FTP. If you want syntax highlighting and suggested snippets use VS Code with the HubL language extension by wspiro and also install the jinja extension mentioned in the HubL extension readme
you can’t do EVERYTHING locally but you can do a fair amount. for things you can’t you’ll still need to use the web UI
give your feedback on this in the <#CBZK16L9L|ftp-feedback> channel
<@UFH0PPMEW> I'm using that HubSpot-frontend-local repo right now
In my opinion, it's much much better/more efficient than using local hubl server
There's a couple bugs in there, but they're easy to fix/work around

For those of you developing locally, are you using the VS Code HubL lang extension?  (<https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=WilliamSpiro.hubl>)

I am curious to hear about its utility (or lack thereof) from someone who has been using it in the real world :world_map:
no :confused:
I generally don't use HubL until my codebase is in HS, I've never found  a workflow using it locally that actually saved me time
I'm using it now and loving it
using it in conjunction with absanter/HubSpot-frontend-local has been great.
<@U54TVT3C1> what's absanter?
<https://github.com/Absanater/HubSpot-frontend-local/commits?author=Absanater>
I stumbled on this repo a few months ago.  Accomplishes stuff I've been trying to figure out for years.
Main highlights are browsersync for editing styles/scripts and the Gulp deploy for directly uploading CSS, JS, and Hubl to HubSpot
Essentially, all the benefits of working with local-hubl-server, without local hubl server.
And no need to run around moving files into place when you're ready to deploy to live
P.S., if you do end up using it.  Adding `?hsDebug=True` to the end of your start url solves the combined css issue.

yeah, this is closer in line to what I've done in the past, which would actually make sense for HubL. My former workflow was using a build system to create a static HTML site, then go through a migration process adding in HubL code in the cloud IDE. Still looking for a better way to manage modules locally though :confused:

Oh, and despite what he says, you can use it to deploy hubl.

I'm still holding my breath for a custom-modules api docs so I can get this working directly with modules.
For right now, I just use modules to store HTML/Hubl.  All my SCSS/JS gets stored in partials and loads to a single style sheet.

<@UFH0PPMEW>... what <@U7SL518D6> said ... plus, I will say, this is a huge priority for HubSpot product team and they are actively exploring how to take the local dev experience to another level. I'd stay active in the <#CBZK16L9L|ftp-feedback> channel and post questions/pains/ideas there. The product team is creeping in there. :slightly_smiling_face:
cc. <@UFH0PPMEW>
